sen.j: 後土御門天皇（ごつちみかどてんのう、嘉吉2年5月25日（1442年7月3日） - 明応9年9月28日（1500年10月21日））は、室町時代の第103代天皇（在位寛正5年7月19日（1464年8月21日） - 明応9年9月28日（1500年10月21日））。
sen.e: Emperor Go-Tsuchimikado (July 3rd, 1442 - October 21st, 1500) was the 103rd Emperor during Muromachi period. (his reign was August 21st, 1464 to October 21st, 1500.)
Emperor Go-Tsuchimikado (July 3, 1442 - October 21, 1500), the 103rd Emperor, reigned in the Muromachi period from August 21, 1464 to October 21, 1500)
Emperor Gotsuchimikado (July 3, 1442 - October 21, 1500), the 103rd Emperor, reigned in the Muromachi period from August 21, 1464 to October 21, 1500.

sen.j: 後花園天皇の譲位を受けて即位。
sen.e: He enthroned after Emperor Go-Hanazono abdicated and passed the position to him.
He was enthroned after the abdication of Emperor Go-Hanazono, who passed the position to him.
He was enthroned after the abdication of Emperor Gohanazono, who passed the position to him.

sen.j: 即位後ほどなく応仁の乱がおき、寺社や公卿の館は焼け、朝廷の財源は枯渇し朝廷は衰微した。
sen.e: Soon after the enthronement the Onin War occurred, temples and shrines, Court nobles Palaces are burnt down, the Imperial Palace was financially fragile and collapsed.
Soon after the enthronement the Onin War occurred, and temples, shrines and court nobles' palaces were burned down; subsequently, the Imperial Palace, which was financially fragile, collapsed.
Soon after the enthronement the Onin War occurred, and temples, shrines and court nobles' palaces were burned down; subsequently, the Imperial Palace, which was financially fragile, collapsed.

sen.j: 乱をさける為、足利義政の室町第に10年の間避難生活を強いられた。
sen.e: He was forced to escape living in Muronachi Dai (the mansion of the ASHIKAGA family) for ten years to be away from the War.
sen.cmt: 室町第→Muromachi Dai (the mansion of the Ashikaga Family) [定訳不明]
sen.e: He was forced to escape, whereupon he lived at Muromachi Dai (the mansion of the ASHIKAGA family) for 10 years in order to be away from the war.
He was forced to escape, whereupon he lived at Muromachi Dai (the mansion of the Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA) for ten years in order to be away from the war.
sen.cmt: 数字をスペルアウトしました。Yoshimasa ASHIKAGAとしました。

sen.j: 乱の終結後、朝廷の古来の儀式の復活に熱意を注ぐが思うように行かず、明応9年9月28日、崩御している。
sen.e: After the War, the Emperor was keen to restore the traditional events of the Imperial Palace, however it did not go so well, he died on September 28th, Meio 9.
After the war, the Emperor was keen to restore the traditional events of the Imperial Palace; however, it didn't go so well, and he died on September 28, Meio 9.
After the war, the Emperor was keen to restore the traditional events of the Imperial Palace; however, it didn't go so well, and he died on September 28, 1500
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変換しました。

sen.j: 明応の政変に憤慨して一時は譲位を決意するが、老臣である大納言甘露寺親長の諫奏によって取りやめる。
sen.e: He was furious about the political disturbance in Meio era and decided to abdicate one stage, however he did not do so after receiving advice from the chief councilor of state, Chikanaga KANROJI who was an old aides of Emperor's.
sen.cmt: 明応の政変→the political disturbance in Meio era [定訳不明]
sen.e: He was furious about the political disturbance in the Meio era and decided to abdicate the throne; however, he didn't do so after receiving advice from the chief councilor of state, Chikanaga KANROJI, who had long been an aide to the Emperor.

He was furious about the Coup of Meio and decided to abdicate the throne; however, he didn't do so after receiving advice from Dainagon (chief councilor of state), Chikanaga KANROJI, who had long been an aide to the Emperor.
sen.cmt: Coup of Meio としました。"the chief councilor of state"→"Dainagon (chief councilor of state)"に変更しました。

sen.j: その背景には朝廷に譲位の儀式のため費用がなく、その費用を政変を起こした細川政元に借りるという自己矛盾に陥る事態を危惧したとも言われている。
sen.e: As the Imperial Palace was close to bankrupt at that time, it is said the Emperor concerned the worst situation to borrow money to have an enthronement ceremony from Masamoto HOSOKAWA, who caused the actual WAR.

Because the Imperial Palace was nearly bankrupt at that time, it is said that the Emperor was concerned over the worst situation in which money would have to be borrowed from Masamoto HOSOKAWA for an enthronement ceremony, even though he had caused the war.

Because the Imperial Palace was nearly bankrupt at that time, it is said that the Emperor was concerned over the worst situation in which money would have to be borrowed from Masamoto HOSOKAWA for an enthronement ceremony, even though he had caused the war.

sen.j: 死後、葬儀の費用もなく一か月以上御所に遺体がおかれていた。
sen.e: After the Emperor died, his body was left at Imperial Palace for more than one month since they did not have enough fund to have a funeral.
After the Emperor died, his body remained at the Imperial Palace for more than a month because there weren't enough funds for a funeral.
After the Emperor died, his body remained at the Imperial Palace for more than a month because there weren't enough funds for a funeral.

sen.j: 京都市伏見区深草坊町の深草北陵（ふかくさのきたのみささぎ）に葬られた。
sen.e: The Emperor was entombed in Fukakusa no Kita no Misasagi at Fukakusa Bo-cho Town, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City.
The Emperor was entombed in Fukakusa no Kita no Misasagi at Fukakusa Bo-cho Town, in the Fushimi ward of Kyoto City.
The Emperor was entombed in Fukakusa no Kita no Misasagi at Fukakusa Bo-cho, in the Fushimi Ward of Kyoto City.
sen.cmt: Town を削除しました。Ward としました。

sen.j: また、遺骨の一部は、父・後花園天皇と同様に、京都市上京区の般舟院陵（はんしゅういんのみささぎ）に分骨された。
sen.e: The part of his remains were left at Hanshu in no Misasagi, Kamigyo Ward, Kyoto City, same way as it was done for his father, Emperor Go-Hanazono.
A portion of his remains was left at Hanshu in no Misasagi, in the Kamigyo ward of Kyoto City, as was done in the case of his father, Emperor Go-Hanazono.
A portion of his remains was left at Hanshuin no Misasagi, in the Kamigyo Ward of Kyoto City, as was done in the case of his father, Emperor Gohanazono.
sen.cmt: Ward, Gohanazono に修正しました。
